intro: Parthenium confertum, commonly known as the clustered ragweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces a large number of lightweight seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Parthenium confertum is an annual plant that thrives in warm climates and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
